moves.4... Bxb4 5. c3: Standard moves. Some moves include Bd5- the classical variation, Ba5- Compromised defence, Be7 and the dubious 5.Bf8?
moves.5... Bc5: The classical variation of the Evans gambit. Main line is O-O here but instead I strike the centre first.
moves.6. d4 exd4 7. cxd4 Bb6 8. O-O: This transposes into the Classical Variation.
moves.8... h6: Time wasting move although there wasn't really any good moves. Nf6 would get crushed by e5. Na5 or d6was probably best here although i could play Ng5 if he played d6.
moves.9. Bb2: My bishop is now on the long a1-h8 diagonal and exerts a tonne of pressure.
moves.9... Nf6 10. Re1: 10.e5 was far better. I gave him time to castle.
moves.10... O-O 11. e5 Nh7 12. a4: Passive square for the knight. Now I am probably overextending my pawns. He/she has a queenside pawn majority of 3-1. ALthough i have a nice space advantage he is still up a pawn and could hold the position together. Hiss extra pawn may win for him in the endgame.
moves.12... a6: Providing an escape square for the bishop if a5 is played. a5 can not be played immediately as I would lose another pawn and he'd be up 2 solid pawns.
moves.13. Nc3 d6: Trying to break up my pawn structure.
moves.15... Na5: Probably played too late. My bishop wanted to come to d3 and attack squares on the g and h file.
moves.16. Bd3 Nf6 17. Qc2 Bg4 18. Kh1: I waste no time to prevent doubled pawns. I move my king because of the potential pressure on the g file.
moves.18... Bxf3 19. gxf3 Re8: Offers the exchange of rooks. If accepted it would be an easy win for black.
moves.20... Rc8: Trying to get some form of counterplay. Exerts pressure on my queen.
moves.21. Qd2: getting ready for some king side attack. Best here was kf8, getting ready to run to the queenside.
moves.21... Nb3: This is a fork but i don't really care. I'll let him have the rook as long as I have a better position.
moves.25. Bxe4 Qc7: Sees the threat on f6. This is now a forced win for me....
moves.26. Bf6+:
26. Bf6+ Kd7 27. Bf5+ wins the game. If 27. ... Re6 QxF7 or Bxe6. Although I ended up victorious I clearly failed to gain an considerable advantage durinng the first 10 moves and only inaccuracy's and blunders from the opposition guided me to victory. 


I assume that most of you would know the continuations. I just put the continuations for the people who didn't know.
